author: checkpoint
title: Destination CARDANO
description: Blockchain is alien, scary and misunderstood to those that aren't involved.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal offers an excellent partnership opportunity that will help a primed audience - engaged readers and consumers of media about gaming and its social influences and impacts - to learn about Cardano, engage with it in the form of the metaverse, NFTs, and Checkpoint tokens, and by virtue of this hopefully become engaged in Cardano itself. The reason I rate this a 3 stars and not a 5 is because while the "why" of this proposal is rock solid, the "what" and "how" are unclear, and the connection hasn't been fully made between Checkpoint's content and rolling out of merchandise, content, and metaverse experiences, and this brief's goal of increasing engagement of Cardano community members in roles that suit them well, are meaningful, and contribute to shared success. I do think this proposal has some excellent ideas for ways to draw a new target market into the Cardano fold - people who are already passionate about gaming and interested in learning about its philosophical and social implications are so well suitd to become invested in, intrigued by, and active participants of the Cardano ecosystem. But the connections between Checkpoint's offerings and this challenge's request need to be made more explicit.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer, Tamer Asfahani, has a strong track record of creating innovative and high quality work that pushes to engage Web 2.0 media consumers through Web 3.0 experiences and content. Based on his backround in journalism and the success he has had in creating a vibrant example of a Web 3.0 media hub, I think he and his team are well equipped to carry through this proposal. It also appears that they are already using Cardano to create their tokens and sell NFTs to readers, and will be creating Cardano-focused content whether or not this proposal is funded - although the funding will help them to do it better, sooner, and more deeply. This is further evidence that this proposal would move forward by virtue of its relevance to the existing Checkpoint space and the proposer's enthusiasm for Cardano.
f6_assessments.q2: I'm disappointed to give this a 3 instead of 5 star rating, because I think that this proposal offers some truly exciting, well structured, naturally mutally beneficial, strong solutions to bringing new members into the Cardano space, and educating them about Cardano. However, after reading the proposal multiple times, I am still left asking questions about what exactly the proposal is offering to do. What is clear is that Checkpoint, founded by the proposer, is an innovative media hub using Web 3.0 experiences to engage readership in new ways, pushing the envelope for what media experiences can and should look like, using the chosen medium (ex: metaverse) to convey the message, rather than just descriptive words in an anachronistic article. It's clear that Cardano is valued by the team at Checkpoint, as they are building on Cardano to offer NFTs, tokens, and more.  However, I'm not exactly sure what the proposed project is! In the summary of the solution, for example, the proposer writes, "Checkpoint champions Cardano, has an established non-crypto audience, is respected in the games industry and is trusted by its readership." While this makes a strong case for a partnership between Cardano and Checkpoint, it tells me about why Checkpoint is a natural fit for creating content about Cardano, but it doesn't tell me what Checkpoint is actually going to do to address the brief's challenge. Will they be producing a podcast about Cardano? Creating Cardano experiences in the metaverse? Interview Cardano users? Later in the proposal, these are vaguely addressed, as they describe how the proposed solution will address the challenge. The majority of this section is spent making the case for why Checkpoint is in a unique, qualified position to educate gamers about Cardano (which is true) - but when it comes to the actual solution, all they say is "by using our platform, real-world applications and interviews with industry shakers, we can help break down the barrier between blockchain and normal users. We combine this with our metaverse offering..." - and I'm still unclear. So, they will be doing interviews? And doing something in the metaverse Cardano-related - but what, exactly? How does using the platform and real-world applications meet the brief challenge (and what, exactly, does the latter even mean?). In the budget section, a third of the budget is allocated for "Competitions for our non-crypto followers," but I'm not sure what this actually means, and would appreciate greater detail and clarification. Similarly, there is $3,000 allocated to AMA sessions in the Checkpoint Multiverse - would these be hosted by folks working deeply with Cardano? Would they be Cardano-specific AMA sessions? How would they specifically meet the challenge of the brief? Again, I can infer how they could, but it would be better if I didn't have to guess. If this was made more explicit and clear, I think this would be a really knockout winning proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem statement of this proposal rings true and is consistent with the challenge’s aim to increase awareness of Project Catalyst as the most active open innovation platform.  Solving this problem “of blockchain being alien, scary, and misunderstood”, will help to increase the number of potential newcomers to the community.  The proposal seeks to leverage an existing audience using an established media brand.  What’s great about this is they already have the “eyeballs”, to which they will be sending a new message about Cardano.  This is an effective and efficient approach to increase awareness about Cardano and Project Catalyst.  The only thing missing is an understanding of the size of this existing audience. Nothing on their website could be found to get an understanding of the circulation. The checkpoint twitter account has 364 followers, the checkpoint Facebook page has 326 followers, the Instagram has 1067 followers, the Youtube channel has 47 subscribers
f6_assessments.q1:
The team is composed of a single individual with many years of experience as a journalist. Based on the plan produced, the team could use more strength on the business and management side.  They plan to target their existing audience and utilize the Checkpoint brand to champion Cardano.  What’s missing here is a clearer idea as to what the deliverables are.  How many articles will be written and when?  How many subjects will be covered and how many articles will be written about those subjects?  What are the specific ways that they plan to engage their community in this effort?

The budget is simple and clear as to what categories of activities the funds will be used for.  However, what’s missing is a timeline and details.  When will these activities be started and finished?  What specifically will the $5,000 in marketing be used for?  How many AMA sessions will be done?
f6_assessments.q2: Auditability is weak.  What’s missing are the metrics and KPIs that will be used to measure progress and success.  They indicate that it is easy for them to measure how the audience moves within the brand.  What would be helpful is some detail regarding how that is done and what they are aiming to achieve.  What are the specific goals they hope to achieve?  It sounds like they have an understanding of their audience and can measure engagement on their platform.  So based on that they could extrapolate what they would see as far as engagement metrics, set some initial goals, and measure how close they get.

f6_assessments.q0: Stated problem and proposed solution is out of scope of current campaign. The goal of this campaign is to help new Catalyst members find a role that best fits them and allows them to contribute in meaningful ways. This campaign is not about education or reach of Cardano or blockchain in general, although these are very important issues that are being addressed in various other campaigns. I suggest resubmitting this idea when/if a dedicated funding campaign comes out.
f6_assessments.q1: Plan should be more detailed, connected to necessary funding and have a clear timeline. Without these simple steps it becomes very hard to evaluate the feasibility of proposal. Proposer definitely has enough experience and competence to execute on proposal, but more work needs to be put into actual proposal for voters.
f6_assessments.q2: It will be very hard to audit this project because no milestones, quantifiable deliverables or KPIs have been set. A more structured approach to planning and goal setting would greatly increase auditability.

f6_assessments.q0:
Destination Cardano intends to leverage checkpoint a multifaceted media outlet to promote Cardano. Checkpoint itself is an exciting and established project.

Unfortunately in this proposal it is unclear how this platform will be used to promote Cardano and on-board new members. It states that simply by association with Cardano it’s community will want to find out more but does not state how it will be associated with Cardano. In fact throughout the proposal Cardano is hardly mentioned with  the emphasis on educating about Crypto, Blockchain technologies and blockchain solutions. Although relevant and needed this broader approach  has a lesser impact on the Cardano ecosystem specifically and dose not address onboarding new members.
f6_assessments.q1:
Destination Cardano through the checkpoint platform and it’s team have the skills and experience to effectively address their problem statement.

There is not enough details to make clear judgement on the feasibility of this project. The majority of this proposal simply describes the checkpoint platform and audience but does not address how the requested funding impacts the platform audience or Cardano.

A structured plan and measurable goals are needed to improve the star rating.
f6_assessments.q2:
As this proposal is written by an experienced journalist I would expect the proposal to be laid out more clearly. A detailed budget of $15000 In my mind consists of more than 16 words! There are no measurable KPIs. The statement of what dose success look like for this project describes the normal activity of the checkpoint project today without input from this Destination Cardano proposal. 

The Checkpoint team is strong and the proposer hear Tamer is both experienced and recognised in his field. The work they have produced in checkpoint is exciting, relevant and worthy. With some of that obvious care and passion channeled towards a proposal there is no reason the scores here wouldn’t improve dramatically.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal has a strong focus on educating the Checkpoint community on the Cardano ecosystem, including NFTs.  This will certainly lead to greater adoption of Cardano.  This proposal does not specifically address onboarding new users to Project Catalyst and because of this, does not directly address this challenge.  It may have been better categorized in the misc category for this fund.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has a background in broadcast media and has developed an audience for their content. A budget is presented with appropriate categories.  The proposal could be strengthened with more detail on how the funds would be spent.  It seems likely, based on the proposer's experience, that this plan could be implemented for the funds allocated and in a timely manner.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer can provide metrics on engagement with the media produced and plans to monitor social media engagement.  This proposal could be improved with consideration of additional KPI that would support the challenge of onboarding new users or facilitating meaningful engagement with Project Catalyst.

f6_assessments.q0: Since it is already a well-established media, it would be easier seize the oppotunity of introducing Cardano and blockchain to the loyal users. With its varied media, there are many ways that blockchain could be explained and used in integrated to its existing content, especially with the metaverse. The challenge described is valid one, but I would like a bit more detail on how they plan to mitigate it. Is there already a concrete idea on how to attract the existing users to the universe of blockchain?
f6_assessments.q1:
The project could benefit from a more detailed schedule. It mentions that it would require a wallet and web integration, so I would like to know how long it would take and when it would happen. Even though the project seems feasible because of the fact that it would use an already existing platform, I think the project could have more detail on the phases of the project.
I would also like to know what is included in the Marketing and Community management part of the budget, as it is a bit vague.
I think a more defined marketing strategy to create buzz among Checkpoint users could expand the project's ability to bring new members.
f6_assessments.q2: I think it is very positive that it is easy to measure the acceptability of the bloclchain-related content, but there could more specific KPIs that would define the project's success. From the proposal, it is not clear how they will know if they are in fact bringing more members to the Cardano universe.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer has identified a problem and a solution to the problem, but they are presented in a vague manner (the statement for the solution makes it looks like it has no output - what is to be delivered?).
It is unclear what is the real value that can be added to the Cardano ecosystem. ("Just by association to Cardano, the audience will be interested to find out more." - it is enough to retain the users?)
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer does not provide enough evidence (references, links, etc.) of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal.

The budget is broken down into items but they are difficult to understand for their meaning ("Competitions for our non-crypto followers" - what is the meaning of this item? and how do your separate the non-crypto from the crypto followers? - what type of competitions will be running? - is this model efficient for retaining users into the Cardano ecosystem?)

The proposer has not considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation. (Twitter and Discord servers are flooded with bots impersonating humans - how do you mitigate this?)
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal, as it is, makes it difficult for an objective assessment. The proposer should define KPI/metrics to measure the success of the project implementation (how do you quantify the number of users that will be integrated into the Cardano ecosystem?)

The proposal looks more like a concept than as a working product.

f6_assessments.q0:
Interesting group of proposers. I've been through their orange paper, quite extensive and everything is explained in detailed. They are who they claim they are with an emphasis on attempting to verify their audience, which is not super big but it's there. I am on the fence regarding this proposal's effectiveness in regards towards the Challenge key metrics, for it to be more effective they would need to get to know the community better. It seems they have not been through Project Catalyst and all our communities but personally would not mind giving them a chance for although not super big they do exist in each and everyone of the digital and social media platform provided.

Another reason why I am on the fence regarding this proposals effectiveness is due to that it only addresses the issue of attendance onto Project Catalyst. Add to that they are a niche media group that has been around for 5 years and has yet to gain a massive following. Not to mention they focus on gaming. Cardano's gaming ecosystem to my understanding has not established themselves yet, hence would it be even effective for the proposers to market Cardano or for Cardano to market to them.
f6_assessments.q1: Based on their general experiences (consistently in the media industry) which are provided in their LinkedIn links and compare that to what they intend to achieve, which are engagement action plans such as; AMA's, competitions, community management and marketing, it is likely they will execute their solutions well. What is most interesting and instill confidence is their partners. One of their partners co-founded Somnium Space and having gone through Somnium Space details, it is impressive and adds weight to the proposers. While the other is a Senior Producer and Development Director at Electronic Arts, which also adds weight to the proposers.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposers do not specifically mention how are they going to measure their progress, when it will take place, who are the potential speakers and many more missing pieces. From what they state, the only have asked us to believe in them, to believe their experience as a media outlet. Again this shows they have not connected with the community yet and perhaps does not fully understand what are our values and how we operate. This is evermore made clear with their success statement as following; "...success looks like people consuming our content across the brand...". Which is not wrong but not aligned with this Challenge's key metrics.

f6_assessments.q0: They already have a big system and community that will help a lot to promote Cardano. Collaborating with already-success-project is a common and effective way to promote and attract new commers. However, because their project mainly focus on other things, the goal to attract new members to Cardano community can be not meet.
f6_assessments.q1: The available resources of the project give the team great potential for successful implementation. However, the proposal should include a more detailed implementation plan. For example, how they can help break down the barrier between blockchain and normal users by using their platform?
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal need to include Roadmap which will help to track the progress of the project and the key metrics for each stage to measure the success of it. Though it makes sense that since they are media outlet, it's easy for them to measure how the audience moves within the brand, it would be better if the proposal includes the demonstration to how they measure it (for example through which metrics etc).

solution: Checkpoint champions Cardano, has an established non-crypto audience, is respected in the games industry and is trusted by its readership.
experience: I've been a journalist for over 20 years and have come from a BBC and Guardian background - broadcast journalist (award winning). I have been in the games industry for over 15 years working and launchings some of the most recognisable gaming sites specialising in audiences.
